content.description: This is a beautiful moderate with just a few hard 5.9 moves and then miles of easy terrain! P1) climb the obvious and easy ow to the slab above. Go all the way back. We belayed on the ledge above the crevice. 5.7. P2) a couple of funky placements on easy terrain leads to the first bolt 25’ up and left. Crux out going past the bolts to the chicken heads and climb up easy 5th class until the rope drag becomes too much. 5.9. P3) continue up more easy chicken heads and slab to a 2 bolt rap station. 5.5R. P4) walk up slab to the summit blocks. Do some moves thru the ledges to the top. 5.6/7pg.    Descent: you pretty much rap the route. We did the 1st two raps from the summit with a single 70 and the last rap we did with double ropes. The 1st and 3rd raps are from chicken heads. The last rap was located roughly 30’ right of where I belayed on top of P2.You might want to bring extra tat…
content.protection: Single rack of gear small to #5 and many slings

content.description: This is the dome that makes up the left side of the Gap. There are some committing, old school climbs on the S. Face and a good moderate romp straight up the Buttress that starts in the main drainage
